text: Dr. Edwin G. Krebs (June 6, 1918 â€“ December 21, 2009) was an American biochemist. He and Edmond H. Fischer were awarded the Nobel Prize in Physiology or Medicine in 1992 for describing how reversible phosphorylation works as a switch to activate proteins and control different cellular processes. ==References== *Hughes, R. 1998. After the Prize *Krebs, E.G.
